metadata.Title: CVE-2019-3880 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the way samba implemented an RPC endpoint emulating the Windows registry service API. An unprivileged attacker could use this flaw to create a new registry hive file anywhere they have unix permissions which could lead to creation of a new file in the Samba share. Versions before 4.8.11, 4.9.6 and 4.10.2 are vulnerable.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-3880` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20
libpam-smbpass - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20
libpam-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20
libsmbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20
libsmbsharemodes0 - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20
libwbclient0 - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20
python-samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20
registry-tools - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20
samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20
samba-common - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20
samba-common-bin - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20
samba-libs - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20
samba-testsuite - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20
smbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20
winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20').
